objects.name: Analytic 0835
objects.description: Behavioral sequence of unauthorized privilege escalation via permission modification: (1) chmod/chown/setfacl process execution with suspicious parameters, (2) Targeting of critical system files or unusual permission values, (3) Correlation with non-privileged user context or unusual timing patterns, (4) Follow-on file access indicating successful permission bypass

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: syscall in (chmod, fchmod, fchmodat, chown, fchown, fchownat, setxattr, lsetxattr, fsetxattr)

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:PROCTITLE
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: proctitle contains chmod, chown, setfacl, or attr commands with suspicious parameters

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Octal permission values that indicate potential malicious intent (default: 777, 755, 4755)
Linux filesystem paths requiring enhanced monitoring (/etc/, /usr/bin/, /home/)
User accounts permitted to perform system-level permission modifications
Statistical threshold for detecting unusual permission modification frequency
